title: Getting Started with Node.js
content: Node.js is a JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 engine. In this post, we will explore the basics of Node.js and how to set up your first server.
author: John Doe

title: Mastering React Components
content: React components are the building blocks of any React application. Learn about functional and class components, and how to use props and state effectively.
author: Jane Smith

title: Introduction to MongoDB
content: MongoDB is a NoSQL database that stores data in a flexible, JSON-like format. In this blog, we will discuss how to set up MongoDB and use it in your applications.
author: Emily Johnson

title: Understanding RESTful APIs
content: RESTful APIs are a powerful way to allow applications to communicate over HTTP. In this post, we will cover the fundamentals of designing and using REST APIs.
author: Michael Brown

title: Deploying Your Web Application to AWS
content: In this tutorial, we'll guide you through the process of deploying a simple web application to Amazon Web Services (AWS), including setting up EC2 instances and S3 buckets.
author: Sarah Lee
